The Energy Flow Basis


Energy flow polynomials (EFPs) are a set of observables, indexed by unique multigraphs, which linearly span the space of infrared and collinear safe (IRC-safe) observables.


A generic EFP is defined as:

 \text{EFP}_G =  \sum_{i_1=1}^M \cdots \sum_{i_N = 1}^M z_{i_1}\cdots z_{i_N} \prod_{(k,\ell)\in G} \theta_{i_k i_\ell}

where $z_i$ is a measure of the energy of particle $i$ and $\theta_{ij}$ is a measure of the angular separation between particles $i$ and 
j
.
